alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Nacogdoches (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:18AM CST until January 30 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Angelina River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Nacogdoches and Angelina Counties. For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Angelina River near Alto. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of the river bottom. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Sunday was 29.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 21.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.2 feet on 12/19/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 930 AM CST.
